item.title: Identifying Financial Crises Using Machine Learning on Textual Data
item.description: Using text analyis on OECD Economic Outlooks to nowcast and forecast economic crises.

item.title: Replication: Common Shocks in Stocks and Bonds
item.description: A class project to replicate the work of Anna Cieslak and Hao Pang's 2021 paper, Common Shocks in Stocks and Bonds

item.title: About Me
item.description: CV.pdf Economics PhD Student, Brown University, 2021 - Present Research Interests business cycles monetary policy macro-finance text analysis I grew up in Pittsboro, North Carolina in the middle of the woods. For college, I went to Furman University in South Carolina, where I studied mathematics, economics, and political science. Afterwards, I spent three years as a research assistant at the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve in Washington, DC.

item.title: The Global Recovery: Lessons from the Past
item.description: The COVID-19 recesion is extremely severe compared to past recessions, but perhaps there is evidence that the recovery will also be steep.
